text: The following are advantages of overpopulation except
explanation: Insufficient food is a disadvantage of overpopulation because as a result of the high influx of people into an area, there will not be sufficient food to cater for the high population which leads to food shortage, especially in developing countries

text: Which of the following is best defined as the movement of people from one geographical area to another involving permanent or temporary residence or settlement
explanation: Migration is the movement of people from one geographical area to another involving permanent or temporary residence or settlement

text:
Use the information on country Y below to answer the question that follows:
Land area = 200,000km \(^{2}\)
Population = 10,000,000.

calculate the population density of country Y
explanation: Population density of country Y = Total population of country Y/Land Area of country YPopulation density of country Y = 10,000,000 persons/200,000 km2=50 persons per km2

text: The birth rate of a country can be increased through the following except
explanation: Inadequacy of health services is very common in developing countries. This will lead to a high mortality rate in such country

text: The following are areas of lowlands in Nigeria except in Nigeria
explanation: The Eastern Scarpland is an area of highlands in Nigeria. It is found within the eastern region of Nigeria, especially around Enugu and Nsukka. The major highland in this area is the Udi-Nsukka Plateau(300-600m)

text: The wind which blows across the Atlantic Ocean towards the coast of Nigeria and is responsible for rainy season is known as
explanation: The equatorial Easterlies blows around the equator from the east, land breeze blows from the land to the sea, sea breeze blows from the sea to the land. The Tropical continental airmass blows across the sahara desert towards Nigeria but the Tropical maritime airmass blows across the Atlantic ocean towards the coast of Nigeria and is responsible for rainy season

text: Which of the following is not a major river basin in Nigeria?
explanation: River basin refers to the area generally drained by a river and its tributaries. All other options are major river basins in Nigeria except the Sokoto basin

text: Tin-mining activities in Nigeria are the main causes of environmental degradation on the?
explanation: JosPlateau falls in the North-Central highlands. Mining is an economic activity in Jos due to the presence of mineral resources like Tin. Tin-Mining activities results in the environmental degradation on the Jos Plateau

text: The high cost of lumbering operations in tropical forest is mainly due to?

options.C: Absence of pure stands of trees

explanation: In the tropical forest, there is the absence of pure stands of trees. In other words, in the tropical forest, the plant population do not consist largely of members of one specie, variety or type.

text: Which of the following farming activity best describes the rearing of only animals like cattle, sheep and goat mainly in the savanna belt of the north?
explanation: Pastoral farming, also referred to as nomadic herding is the rearing of only animals like cattle, sheep and goat. It is mainly practised in the savanna belt of the north, especially in the sudan savanna

text: The outer structure of the earth is made up of the following except?
explanation: The atmosphere, biosphere and hydrosphere are all outer structure of the earth. The Mesosphere also known as the mantle is an internal structure of the earth which is found beneath the crust and surrounds the core(Barysphere)

text: Which of the following is an importance of the atmosphere to living organisms?

options.A: It provides water for industrial uses
options.B: It provides oxygen for animals and plants for respiration
options.C: It provides shelter in form of timber for man
options.D: It aids transportation through construction of roads and railways

explanation: option A is an importance of the Hydrosphereoption C is an importance of the Biosphereoption D is an importance of the LithosphereThe Atmosphere is the gaseous portion of the earth. It is associated with the provision of gases required by living things e.g oxygen for combustion and respiration, nitrogen for protein synthesis by plants etc.

text: The correct arrangement of the layers of the earth crust from the surface to the interior is
explanation: The crust is subdivided into the upper part, containing minerals like silica, iron and magnesium(sima). The mantle is found beneath the crust and the core is surrounded by the mantle. Hence, the correct arrangement of the layers of the earth crust "sial, sima, mantle and core" from the surface to the interior.

text: If the scale of a map is 2cm to 1km, what is the ground distance if the distance between two towns on the map is 20cm
explanation: map distance = 20cm, ground distance = Ymap scale = 2cm to 1kmsince 2cm ≡ 1km20cm ≡ Y2Y = 20kmY = 20km/2=10kmThe ground distance between the two towns is 10km

text: If the scale of two maps are (a;1:100,000 and b;1:400,000) what is the ground distance if the distance between two towns on the maps is 10cm
explanation: map distance = 10cm, ground distance = ?Map scale for (a) 1:100,000Ground distance = 10 x 100,000/100,000 =10kmMap scale for (b) 1:400,000Ground distance = 10 x 400,000/100,000 =40km

text: Which of the following is a reason for the high volume of trade between Nigeria and developed countries?
explanation: The inclination of some developing countries to their colonial masters has helped to increase the volume of trade between the nations

text: The following are seaports used in the North Atlantic sea route except
explanation: The sea route through which Nigeria and Europe exchange their products is through the North Atlantic sea route and the following seaports are used:Lagos-Antwerp(Belgium), Lagos-Rotterdam(Netherlands), Lagos-Hamburg(West Germany), Lagos-Southampton(Britain) while the sea route through which Nigeria and America exchange their products is the south Atlantic route and seaport used is Lagos-Montreal(Canada)

text: _______ is the condition of the lower atmosphere of a place over a short period
explanation: Weather is the condition of the lower atmosphere of a place over a short period. The weather of a place is always very brief and changes regularly e.g the weather of today could be sunny, rainy or cloudy etc.

text: In a combined maximum and minimum thermometer, the difference between the hottest and coldest daily temperature for that day gives the
explanation: Diurnal range of temperature = Max.temperature - Mini.temperature for that dayMaximum daily temperature ≡ Hottest daily temperatureMinimum daily temperature ≡ Coldest daily temperature

text: _______ is defined as the total surrounding or medium of any organism in a given area
explanation: Environment is defined as the total surrounding or medium of any organism in a given area. This includes the physical surroundings, climatic factors and other living organisms in that surroundings

text: Which of the following processes leads to the loss of carbon from the air
explanation: carbon dioxide is removed from the air during photosynthesis as green plants use it to manufacture their food

text: On maps, lines drawn to join all places in the ocean having equal degree of salinity are called
explanation: Isohalines are lines drawn on maps to join all places in the ocean having equal degree of saltiness or concentration of salt or salinity

text: Where the salinity of an ocean is high;

options.A: the ocean water is dense and flows at the ocean surface towards a low salinity area
options.B: the ocean water is dense and creeps at the bottom of the ocean towards low salinity areas
options.C: the ocean water is light and flows at the area surface towards a high salinity area
options.D: the ocean water is light and flows at the ocean surface towards a low salinity area

explanation: Salinity is one of the causes of ocean currents. Where the salinity of an ocean is high, the ocean water is dense or heavy and creeps(or moves) at the bottom of the ocean to low salinity areas.

text: The type of water left in the soil after excess water has been drained off, following heavy rainfall is known as
explanation: Field capacity is the type of water left in the soil after excess water has been drained off, following heavy rainfall. This water is available to all plants.

text: The part labelled X in the soil profile is known as
explanation: The part labelled X is called the bedrock. It contains solid parent rocks.

text: Which of the following is not a graphical representation of statistical data?
explanation: All except shaded map are graphical representation of statistical data

text: Which of the following is a vegetation characteristics of the Tropical rainforest?

options.A: Trees are not in pure stand
options.B: Tough, small, leathery, hairy leaves to guard against excessive transpiration

explanation: In the Tropical rainforest, the trees are not in pure stand i.e scattered

text: Which of the following is a problem of landlocked countries
explanation: Landlocked countries refer to those countries which do not have an access or boundary with the coast or oceans. Examples are Mali, Niger, Sudan, Zambia etc. Landlocked countries depend politically on other countries.

text: One of the following is not a problem involved in harnessing solar energy?

options.D: Fear of competition with established energy sources

explanation: High cost of harnessing solar energy is a problem while adequacy of capital isn't

text: One of the following surveying instruments is used to set out lines at right angles to the main chain line
explanation: Using either the mirror method or the prism square method, the optical square is used to mark out lines at right angles to the main chain line.

text: ________is the failure of the end point of a closed traverse to fall exactly on the point of origin of the transverse
explanation: Error of closure is the failure of the end point of a closed traverse to fall exactly on the point of origin of the transverse. This error can only be known when the field details are plotted

text: What is the process of lowering and levelling of the earth surface by gradual breaking and wearing away of such earth's surfaces.
explanation: Dendation involves breaking of the earth's surface hence levelling such surface through agents such as water, wind etc.

text: What is the process of lowering and levelling of the earth surface by gradual breaking and wearing away of such earth's surfaces.
explanation: Dendation involves breaking of the earth's surface hence levelling such surface through agents such as water, wind etc.

text: Which of the following is an effect of the earth's revolution?
explanation: The time taken by the earth to move round the sun(i.e complete its orbit) is fixed at 365(1/4) days which makes up a year

text: The soil gains nitrogen through one of the following except
explanation: Denitrification is the major way by which nitrate in the soil is lost by its conversion to gaseous nitrogen with the aid of some denitrifying bacteria

text: Which of the following is a way of controlling soil erosion
explanation: Contour ploughing is the making of ridges across the slope to control erosion

text: __________ is a highland area which seperates the headstreams of rivers flowing in different directions but rising from the same mountainous source
explanation: A Watershed is a highland area which seperates the headstreams of rivers flowing in different directions but rising from the same mountainous source

text: ___________ is a layer of very fine wind-deposited sand and silt?
explanation: Loess are loose, fine particles which are carried by wind and deposited outside the desert. Deposits of loess are found in North-West China

text: An important mineral deposit in south Africa which has attracted a large number of white settler is
explanation: Africa leads the whole world in the production of gold. South Africa is the largest producer of gold.

text: Which of the following gives the correct full meaning of G.I.S?
explanation: G.I.S means Geographic Information System

text: Which of the following statistical mapping techniques is most suitable for showing the spatial distribution of cattle in the different northern states of Nigeria?
explanation: The dot map refers to a diagramatic representation of a large quantity or volume of data by means of dots. Since the spatial distribution of cattle in different northern states of Nigeria is a large volume of data, the dot map is the most suitable statistical mapping technique

text: Plants in the savannah are adapted mainly to alternating periods of high and low?
explanation: The savannah is characterized with summer rainfall and winter dryness. Hence, the plants in the savannah have large trunks to store water for the dry season

text: The prosperity of Kenya depends on the cultivation of
explanation: Kenya happens to be one of the largest producers of coffee(Top 10 ranking), Maize(Top 10 ranking) and Sisal(Top 3 ranking) in Africa

text: Which of the following is not an example of mineral resources?
explanation: All the listed options except latex are mineral resources. Latex is a vegetation resource

text: Arrange the following scales in ascending order: 1:50,000, 1:200,000, 1:200, 1:300,000
explanation: The larger the denominator of a scale, the smaller the scale and the smaller the denominator of a scale, the larger the scale. Hence, the ascending order is 1:300,000< 1:200,000< 1:50,000< 1:200

text: Which of the following is not a precaution to be taken when making a compass traverse?

options.A: The bearing should not be observed from a position close to strongly magnetic materials
options.B: The 'back' bearing should be taken from the other end of the line and should differ from the 'on'/'forward' bearing by exactly 180\(^{o}\)
options.C: All magnetic materials should be removed from the body and pockets of the reader before the bearing is taken
options.D: The compass must be held vertically so that the edge of the card does not rub against the top of the compass

explanation: The compass must be held horizontally, so that the edge of the card does not rub against the top of the compass

text: One of the following is not a sequence of denudation
explanation: The four sequences or stages of denudation are weathering, erosion, transportation and deposition

text: What is the longitude of a town Y whose local time is 12:00 noon when Greenwich mean time is 6:00pm
explanation: Town Y? W|12:00noon ←(substract) Longitude(0^o)|E 6:00pmTime difference = 6:00pm - 12:00pm = 6hoursRecall: 15o ≡ 1 hour therefore 6hours ≡ (15 x 60)o= 90oArrow is pointing to the west;hence, the latitude of Town Y is 90oW

text: Which of the following food chains is impossible?
explanation: The toad cannot consume grass and the grasshopper can't also consume the toad

text: Which of the following activities does not control soil erosion
explanation: Deforestation is the cutting down of trees and it lead to soil erosion. Contour ploughing, cover-cropping and afforestation all prevent and control soil erosion

text: Which of the following is not an importance of Geographic Information System(G.I.S)
explanation: Funds mismanagement is not an importance of Geographic Information System(G.I.S)

text: ________ are projection of highlands into low grounds i.e the v-shape points to the low land?
explanation: Spurs are projection of highlands into low grounds. They separate one valley from another

text: _______ is a large mass of igneous mound with a dome-shaped upper surface and a level base?
explanation: A laccolith is one of the main intrusive land form of vulcanicity. It is a large mass of igneous mound with a dome-shaped upper surface and a level base

text: The instrument used in measuring the intensity of an earthquake is known as?
explanation: The instrument used in measuring the intensity of an earthquake is seismograph. It records the vibrations produced by an earthquake

text: _________ is formed when two corries cut back opposite sides of the same mountain, resulting in a knife-edged ridge
explanation: An arete is a wall-ridge-like structure seperating two corries

text: One of the following is not a favourable condition for siting a settlement
explanation: To site a settlement, the soil must be fertile to promote agricultural activities

text: The name given to two or more towns/cities which have grown to merge with one another is?
explanation: A conurbation is the name given to two or more towns/cities which have grown to merge with one another e.g Lagos-Ikeja(Nigeria), New York-Philadelphia(U.S.A) etc.

text: Which of the following is not a problem of the Economic Community of West Africa States(ECOWAS)?
explanation: Through trade liberilazation, ECOWAS has been able to promote trade among member states

text: Which of the following important fruits is produced in North-West Africa?
explanation: Tangerines are produced in North-west Africa

text: Which of the following statements is right?

options.A: In West Africa, colonial masters encouraged plantation agriculture
options.B: In West Africa, plantation are on fertile lowlands
options.C: In East Africa, management of plantations is less efficient than in West Africa,
options.D: In East Africa, uniformity of climate has made for limited variety of crops

explanation: The only correct statement is that in West Africa, plantation are on fertile lowlands. All other statements are false

text: Interdependence within the ecosystem can best be interpreted to mean that components of the ecosystem
explanation: Interdependence with the ecosystem means the interaction which exist between the biotic and abiotic components of the ecosystem

text: Which of the following is not a measure of environmental control?
explanation: Degradation refers to the lowering of a fluvial surface, such as a floodplain or streambed, through erosional processes

text: Which of the following is not a proof of the earth's sphericity?
explanation: The deflection of winds is an effect of the earth's rotation and it does not prove the earth's sphericity

text: Which of the following types of rock is a source of energy?
explanation: Coal emits heat energy when heated

text: _______ transport is the slowest and the cheapest means of transort
explanation: Rail transport is the slowest and cheapest means of transort

text: Which of the following is a limitation of rail transport in developing countries?
explanation: Lack of technical know-how and poor maintenance is a limitation or problem of rail transport in developing countries

text: One of the following is the most important major ocean(shipping) route
explanation: The north atlantic route is the busiest and most important route that links two most populous and heavily industrialized parts of the world i.e western europe and eastern part of north america

text: Which of the following is a problem of world transportation?
explanation: poor visibility is a perculiar problem to air and ocean transportation due to the formation of fog in the atmosphere

text: One of the following is not a vegetation belt in lagos state
explanation: The rainforest, the fresh water swamp, the coaster mangrove or the salt water swamp are the three vegetation belts of Lagos state

text: All except one are functions of a village
explanation: The mining function is not a function of a town

text: ________ is formed from the combination of several local government areas
explanation: A state is formed from the combination of several local government areas

text: It takes mecury how many days to complete its orbit?
explanation: It takes eighty-eight days for mercury to complete its orbit

text: The relative dryness of the Horn Africa is due to

options.A: The dominance of cold currents in the region
options.B: The shape and direction of the shoreline
options.C: Its closeness to the high ranges of east africa
options.D: The distance from the belt of tropical cyclones

explanation: The direction of the shoreline causes the relative dryness of the Hon Africa

text: The development of a climax vegetation in the savannah belt of Nigeria is disturbed mainly by
explanation: Regular fires prevent trees from establishing and savannahs from turning into forest. Hence, the development of a climax vegetation in the savannah is due to bush burning

text: ______ is a collection of building with people living them
explanation: A settlement is a collection of buildings with people living them. It is a centre for human activities

text: Lines joining places of equal sunshine hours on a map are called?
explanation: Isohels are imaginary lines joining places of equal sunshine hours on a map

text: All except one is a disadvantage of compass traversing

options.C: It can be used to survey a large area

explanation: An advantage of chain surveying is that it can be used to survey a large area

text: When the traverse connects two stations, whose positions are known, what type of traverse is this?
explanation: When the framework forms a closed figure or when the traverse connects two stations, whose positions are known, it is called a closed traverse

text: ______ is a surveying instrument used for measuring the angles of ground slopes
explanation: The watkin's clinometer is used to measure the angles of ground slopes

text: The following are seaports used in the North Atlantic sea route except
explanation: The north atlantic sea route is the sea route through which Nigeria and Europe exchange their products while the south atlantic route is used between nigeria and America in exchange of their products.lagos-Hamburg, Lagos-Rotterdam, Lagos-Southampton are seaports used in the North Atlantic route while Lagos-Newyork is used in the South Atlantic route
